title: VS Code 1.69 Release Party
description: Live event and Q&A with the VS Code team to discuss highlights from the June, 1.69 release.

title: Machine Learning Experimentation with DVC Extension
description: Join us and learn how to manage and make your machine learning projects reproducible with an open source tool DVC and the new extension. We will see how to track datasets and models, run, compare, visualize, and track machine learning experiments right in VS Code.

title: VS Code 1.68 Release Party
description: Live event and Q&A with the VS Code team to discuss highlights from the May 2022, 1.68 release.

title: Excel Add-in Development
description:
Come learn about how easy it is to develop an Excel Add-in and make use of some of the cool new APIs available. In this livestream, we will connect Excel to a live service and create custom functions to make the data accessible in Excel.

Recommended resources:
https://docs.microsoft.com/office/dev/add-ins/excel/

title: VS Code for XAML and C# Devs
description: Who said Visual Studio Code is only for Web developers?! The open-source Uno Platform enables XAML and C# single-codebase apps to run on Web, Linux, Android, iOS, macOS, and Windows. The Uno Platforms VS Code extension provides language features such as XAML and C# completions, Hot Reload, and more. You can now develop a XAML and C# app, using WinUI, right in VS Code. Come learn what the Uno Platform is all about!

title: Ask Me Anything (AMA) with GitLens creator: Eric Amodio
description: Join this livestream for exclusive access to GitLens creator, Eric Amodio, as he participates in an AMA (ask me anything) to take community questions about one of the most popular Git extensions for VS Code. Fire away with questions about the recent launch of GitLens 12, including bringing GitLens to vscode.dev and github.dev, and the addition of optional GitLens+ features for enhanced visualization and team collaboration.

speakers.name: Eric Amodio
speakers.title: CTO at GitKraken, creator of GitLens

title: A Quick Guide to Machine Learning
description: The foundational concepts of machine learning are both easily accessible and super practical! Come prepared to be wowed and amazed with how these concepts may be able to help you and how VS Code helps make it happen.

title: VS Code 1.67 Release Party
description: Live event and Q&A with the VS Code team to discuss highlights from the April 2022, 1.67 release.

title: TypeScript tips and tricks with Matt
description: Special guest and TypeScript guru Matt Pocock joins the stream to teach you the ways of a TypeScript ninja.

title: JSON Data in VS Code with Depot Extension
description: Depot is a data editor built inside of Visual Studio Code that allows you to edit JSON data like a spreadsheet. Join the lead developer as he walks through the functionality and use cases for the tool to see how you can use Depot on projects big and small.

title: VS Code 1.66 Release Party
description: Live event and Q&A with the VS Code team to discuss highlights from the March 2022, 1.66 release.

title: VS Code, Azure ML, and GitHub Codespaces
description:
Learn how to configure your VS Code environment to run your Azure ML projects on GitHub Codespaces,  a new cloud-based development environment that runs your code in a container.

Blog post on this topic: https://bea.stollnitz.com/blog/codespaces-azureml/

title: On-the-go coding on an iPad with Blink Shell and VS Code
description: Being able to push a fix from a phone or work on a project from devices such as tablets has become a developer necessity. Learn how the Blink Shell app integrates with VS Code for Web and GitHub Codespaces for a coding experience tailored for mobile on iOS.

title: Building your own VS Code theme
description: Come learn how to create a custom theme in Visual Studio Code. We will explore how to pick a color palette, setup your local development, and launch it to the public.

speakers.name: Zeno Rocha
speakers.title: VP of Developer Experience at WorkOS

title: Java in VS Code
description: Come learn how to get started with Java in Visual Studio Code. We will go over setting up your development environment and using core tooling in the Java space!

title: Using Laravel in VS Code (start quickly with a dev container)
description: Come learn how to quickly set up a development environment that is ready for you to code with PHP and Laravel, also connecting to services like MySQL and Redis. Using development containers in VS Code, you can jump right into your editor and start coding, trouble free, with a repeatable environment that you can share with others too! And thanks to Laravel's first-class integration with VS Code, you'll see how setting up a project is the matter of running just one command.

title: Testing modern web apps with Playwright and VS Code
description: Playwright is a framework for building end-to-end tests for modern web applications. It can help create tests that are resilient and run on any browser and platform–and it now comes with a new VS Code extension! In this livestream, we'll scaffold a new project from scratch and create some tests for real web pages.

title: VS Code 1.64 Release Party
description: Live event and Q&A with the VS Code team to discuss highlights from the January 2022, 1.64 release.

title: Getting started with Rust in VS Code
description: Come learn how to get started with programming in Rust in Visual Studio Code and set up your development environment. We'll cover setting up the rust-analyzer extension, using code completion to write code faster, how to refactor Rust code, running tests, and debugging.

title: Create a resume website in your browser
description: Want to make your application stand out to recruiters, and learn a few new skills in the process? Using the power of VS Code for the Web and GitHub Pages, we'll code a resume website together in HTML and CSS, completely in your browser window.

title: Note taking inside of VS Code
description:
Dendron is a local, open-source, Markdown-based note-taking tool that helps developers work with notes like they do with code. Our mission is to help humans organize, reference, and work with any amount of knowledge.
In our talk, we'll go over the basics of how Dendron works and do a walkthrough of the core features that let individuals and teams manage tens of thousands of notes inside of VS Code.

title: VS Code 1.63 Release Party
description: Live event and Q&A with the VS Code team to discuss highlights from the November 2021, 1.63 release.

title: Getting started with C++ in VS Code
description: Come learn how to get started with programming in C++ in Visual Studio Code and set up your development environment. We'll cover setting up the C++ extension, setting up debugging, and using IntelliSense to write code faster.

title: Using Docker containers in VS Code
description:
It's time to take a deep-dive into the Docker Extension for VS Code! In this episode, we'll walk you through using key features of the Docker Extension such as scaffolding Dockerfiles, navigating the Docker Explorer, and even take you through some new features such as Docker Compose IntelliSense.

Docker extension for VS Code: https://aka.ms/vscodelive/docker

title: Setting up VS Code for Python beginners
description: We'll explore features of the Python extension that will help you get started with programming in Python with VS Code.

title: VS Code for the Web: vscode.dev
description: We're excited to introduce you to [vscode.dev](https://vscode.dev), bringing a true VS Code experience to the Web that doesn't need to be installed, launches instantly, and works anywhere (*hello, iPad!*). Come see the culmination of a decade of work and learn what you can do with VS Code for the Web.

title: Building a faster web with the Jamstack
description: Join Anthony and Simona to learn about the Jamstack and how to build faster and more secure web applications, all using Visual Studio Code and Azure Static Web Apps.

title: My Favorite Tips and Tricks with VS Code
description: Hi, I'm James and I'm a software developer. I've spent hours researching settings, themes, shortcuts, and other ways to customize VS Code. I'm excited to share some of my favorite tips and tricks with you!

title: Rapid JavaScript/TypeScript prototyping in VS Code
description: Quokka provides the ideal scratchpad experience and makes learning, prototyping and testing JavaScript/TypeScript blazingly fast. Runtime values are displayed in VS Code beside your code. Your code runs immediately as you type, on unsaved changes; no need to do anything manually or switch context.

title: Real-time collaboration with Live Share
description: The Live Share extension enables individuals developers, students, and teams to collaboratively edit and debug their code together, directly from VS Code. Join Jonathan as he demonstrates how Live Share can be used, and showcases some tips & tricks for enjoyable pair programming.

title: VS Code anywhere: GitHub Codespaces and github.dev
description: Join us to celebrate the launch of GitHub Codespaces and github.dev, and learn how you can develop your apps from wherever you are.

title: GitHub with VS Code
description: VS Code and GitHub work beautifully together out of the box, but with extensions take the integration to a whole new level! Come and learn how to level up your daily workflow.

title: Web Debugging in Visual Studio Code
description: Join Connor and Brandon as they develop and debug a webpage with VS Code. You'll learn how to use the JavaScript debugger to fix functional and performance issues in your site, and learn about the new integration with Microsoft Edge DevTools to provide DOM and network debugging right alongside your source code.

title: Build your first VS Code extension
description: Join Tyler as he goes from just an idea to a published extension on the VS Code Marketplace. You’ll learn how to get started on building VS Code extensions, where to find resources, and how to publish them.
